Source code for GoH.utilities

import re
from nltk.tokenize import WhitespaceTokenizer
import os
from os import path
import pandas as pd
from os.path import isfile, join



[docs]def readfile(input_dir, filename):
	""" 
	Reads in file from directory and file name.
	Returns the content of the file.

	Arguments:
	input_dir -- Directory containing the file.
	filename -- Name of file to be read.
	"""
	with open(path.join(input_dir, filename)) as f:
		return f.read()




[docs]def strip_punct(text):
    """ Removes select punctuation marks and numbers from a text
	and replaces them with a space.
	
	Non-permanent changes for evaluation purposes only.

	Uses the re library.

	Arguments:
	text -- Content to be evaluated.
	"""
    text_cleaned = re.sub(r"[0-9,.!?$:;&\"]", " ", text)
    return text_cleaned




[docs]def tokenize_text(text):
    """ Converts file content to a list of tokens.

	Uses the NLTK Whitespace Tokenizer.

	Arguments:
	text -- Content to be tokenized.
	"""
    return WhitespaceTokenizer().tokenize(text)




[docs]def to_lower(tokens):
    """ Converts all tokens to lower case.

	Arguments:
	tokens -- List of tokens generated using a tokenizer
	"""
    return [w.lower() for w in tokens]




[docs]def create_spelling_dictionary(wordlists, directory):
    """
    Compiles a spelling dictionary from one or multiple
    wordlist files. Returns results as a set.

    Arguments:
    wordlists -- List of filenames for the wordlist files.
    directory -- Location of the wordlist files.
    """
    spelling_dictionary = []
    for wordlist in wordlists:
        words = readfile(directory, wordlist).splitlines()
        word_list = [w.lower() for w in words]
        for each in word_list:
            spelling_dictionary.append(each)

    return set(spelling_dictionary)




[docs]def stats_to_df(corpus_statistics):
	"""
	Convert dictionary of corpus statistics to a dataframe for computations

	Arguments:
	corpus_statistics -- 
	"""
	df = pd.DataFrame(corpus_statistics, columns=["doc_id", "error_rate", "num_tokens", "num_errors"])

	return df



def rate_per_doc(corpus_statistics):
    # Gather a list of doc_id and error_rates
    docs_2_rates = {}
    for report in corpus_statistics:
        docs_2_rates.update({report['doc_id']: report['error_rate']})

    return docs_2_rates



def open_original_docs(filenames, text_dir):
    pdf_dir = "/Users/jeriwieringa/Dissertation/text/corpus-pdf/periodicals/"

    print("Opened files: \n")

    for filename in filenames:
        base_filename = filename.split('-')[:-1]
        pdf_filename = "{}.pdf".format('-'.join(base_filename))

        os.system("open {}".format(join(text_dir, filename)))
        os.system("open {}".format(join(pdf_dir, pdf_filename)))

        print("{}\n".format(filename))


def define_directories(prev, cycle, base_dir):
    return({'prev': join(base_dir, prev), 'cycle': join(base_dir, cycle)})
